title: THE ONLY TOOL YOU NEED FOR GRAVEL DRIVEWAY MAINTENANCE!

tasks.task: Operating a tractor and land plane to install driveway gravel
subtasks: Guiding the tractor and land plane over uneven terrain
Ensuring proper drainage by adhering to natural contour
Spreading and grading gravel loads using the land plane
Adjusting land plane blades to create a flat surface or apply a crown
Managing steep drop-offs by redistributing excess gravel
Preparing the area for potential future grading by using stone thickness
Coordinating with gravel dump truck operators for efficient material delivery

tasks.task: Installing flatbed dump truck loads of stone onto the driveway site
subtasks: Guiding the flatbed dump truck to designated drop-off points
Inspecting the dropped material for proper coverage and grading
Assessing moisture content of fresh gravel to determine optimal working conditions

tasks.task: Ensuring operator safety and proper equipment operation
subtasks: Verifying that tractor operators are experienced and skilled
Maintaining proper speed and control while grading to prevent equipment rollover
Using liquid ballast (Rimguard) to improve tractor stability and operator confidence

tasks.task: Implementing drainage management for the driveway
subtasks: Controlling water runoff direction to prevent pooling near the marsh
Protecting the rote fabric from potential damage during future deep grading
Monitoring and adjusting the final slope to ensure proper water drainage
Preparing for potential landscaping around the fence line

tasks.task: Monitoring and adjusting project progress based on initial grading results
subtasks: Evaluating the achieved gradient and making adjustments if necessary
Checking for even coverage and identifying areas needing additional material
Verifying the width and thickness of the installed stone layer
Planning for remaining tasks, such as finishing touches and recontouring
